reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife recently booked us into Clydesdale Manor for a 4 night stay as part of my 40th birthday celebrations.
reviews.title: Perfect for a significant birthday

likes.liked: — all aspects particularly the breakfasts, hosts, location, service, amenities

reviews.text: We stayed in the Premier Room which was a room of very good proportions. The rooms featured a king sized 4 poster bed, leather sofa, wing back chair, reverse cycle air conditioning, multi-channel TV, CD player and a range of international magazines. The mountain view was a bonus.
reviews.title: More than happy with this choice

reviews.text: My wife had selected this property on the basis of prior reviews and as we enjoy sampling fine fare we elected to indulge in the breakfast on 3 mornings during our stay.Without dout this is the best breakfast we have ever had - the daily menu was innovative, delicious and set us up until dinner time.
reviews.title: A Delightful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lynne and Wayne the owners were very gracious people who went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The finishing touches such as returning to find small cakes which had just been baked , fresh flowers from the gardens all add to making this a very special place.
reviews.title: Make sure to visit this place

likes.liked: — Lovely garden aspect and spa bath

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This etablishment is a cut above all else in Tasmania and it is easy to see how Clydesdale Manor has won 8 awards in only 4 years.
reviews.title: Lovely little place but not the best location

likes.liked: — The staff, the room, the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed in the spa suite. There is no doubt that Clydesdale Manor is a beautiful building. We loved the spacious room and high ceilings and our private balcony. The interior decorating is very tasteful. However, I have to agree with a couple of the other reviews in that there is a definite lack of flexibility. I did not personally mind having to fill in a breakfast menu the day before, and determine what time I wanted to have breakast (4 quarter hourly options between 8 and 9), but this could be a problem if you have an early flight for instance, as the breakfast definitely adds to the price of this accommodation and if you miss out you are paying a lot more than you should. Other reviewers also mentioned the inflexibility of choice for breakfast, as there is only one hot dish. When I realised that I would not be able to eat the following day's offering due to a food allergy, I asked Wayne if he could possibly provide me with an egg. Not fussed about how it was cooked, I just wanted something a little more substantial than cereal. This was met with an immediate refusal as the menus are made up 1 week in advance and they couldn't possibly cater for me. We decided to leave a day early, and I have to say in all fairness there was no problem with having to pay for the room even though it had been booked. Wayne did offer me an alternative (pancakes - they definitely have something against eggs) but this didn't happen until we were seated at the breakfast table the next day. Quite honestly, I could not understand this attitude. I have tried to be as fair as possible with this review, but I feel it is a matter which should be considered when deciding whether to stay here. We choose Bed and Breakfasts because they usually provide some degree of individual attention, but in this case we would have been better off in a hotel.
reviews.title: Some things are good, some are bad

reviews.text: I recently enjoyed 5 evening at Clydesdale Manor and can recommend it to Trip Advisor members without reservation.
reviews.title: sensational
Thoroughly Recommended
reviews.text: The hosts, Wayne and Lynne, are top drawer and are 2 of the most professional and hospitable hosts I have ever encountered.

reviews.title: Delightful Ambience
reviews.text: My room was known as the Wellington Room and was very generous in size. Accessories included a large TV, CD player, sound system and very comfortable leather tub chairs. This was a great room to relax in.!

reviews.title: Clydesdale Manor - A Tasmanian Treasure
reviews.text: Breakfasts were among the best I have ever experienced at any establishment and varied each morning.

reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from our honeymoon in Tasmania and want to share with other fellow travellers our thoughts on Clydesdale Manor.

We had originally booked into a self-contained property but only 3 weeks before our wedding the property cancelled our booking. We contacted the Wrest Point Casino who were unable to assist but they recommended Clydesdale Manor.Bearing in mind that we were seeking accommodation for the New Year period and Hobart is extremely busy.
reviews.title: Over Marketed - Over rated
Clydesdale Manor - a Truly Memorable B&B Experience
reviews.text: I am a travel agent with a major Australian group and have recently returned from a tour of Tasmania.

Firstly, I should say that we maintain a database on all properties and follow up with clients about their experiences once they have returned home from holidays. The feedback that we have collected on Clydesdale Manor has always been positive without exception and my own experience there earlier this monht reinforces that positive opinion. Our expectations were that we would have a memorable stay and this was certainly the case.
reviews.title: We Loved Clydesdale Manor

reviews.text: Since returing to NSW I have been reading Trip Advisor reviews of properties that I sampled and have to take time to redress some glaring misconceptions that have been written about Clydesdale Manor.
reviews.title: A tale of 2 cities

reviews.text: In particular I notice that the negative comments all seem to centre around getting value for money.
reviews.title: Disappointing for the price
One of the Best.......
reviews.text: Please do not be put off by the ramblings of the disenfranchised who feel they need to grumble for whatever reason. I am sure that you will agree that you cannot satisfy everyone 100% of the time. One only has to look at the reviews on this site and see that most properties have attracted both good and bad comments.
